com.topjohnwu.superuser

Class Shell

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.topjohnwu.superuser.Shell
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public abstract class Shell
extends Object
implements Closeable
    A class providing an API to an interactive (root) shell.

    In most cases, developers do not need to directly access a Shell instance. Use these high level APIs instead:

    • sh(String...)
    • su(String...)
    • sh(InputStream)
    • su(InputStream)
    These methods not only uses the global shell instance but are also more convenient to use. The global shell instance is constructed on-demand and cached. To get the instance directly, call getShell() or getShell(GetShellCallback).

    Developers can check the example that came along with the library, it demonstrates many features the library has to offer.

      static interface  Shell.Task
      A task that can be executed by a shell with the method execTask(Task).

      • FLAG_REDIRECT_STDERR

        public static final int FLAG_REDIRECT_STDERR
        If set, STDERR outputs will be stored in STDOUT outputs.

        Note: This flag only affects the following methods:

        • sh(String...)
        • su(String...)
        • sh(InputStream)
        • su(InputStream)
        • Shell.Job.to(List)
        Check the descriptions of each method above for more details.

    • Method Detail

      • execTask

        public abstract void execTask(@NonNull
                              Shell.Task task)
                       throws IOException
        Execute a Task with the shell. USE THIS METHOD WITH CAUTION!

        This method exposes raw STDIN/STDOUT/STDERR directly to the task. This is meant for implementing low-level operations. Operation may stall if the buffer of STDOUT/STDERR is full, so it is recommended to use separate threads to read STDOUT/STDERR if you expect large outputs.

        STDOUT/STDERR is cleared before executing the task. No output from any previous tasks should be left over. It is the developer's responsibility to make sure all operations are done: the shell should be in idle and waiting for further input to be sent to STDIN when the task returns.

        Parameters:
        task - the desired task.
        Throws:
        IOException - I/O errors when doing operations with STDIN/STDOUT/STDERR

      • getCachedShell

        @Nullable
public static Shell getCachedShell()
        Get the cached global Shell instance
        Returns:
        a Shell instance, null if no active shell is cached.

      • getShell

        @NonNull
public static Shell getShell()
        Get Shell via getCachedShell() or create new if required. If getCachedShell() returns null, it will call newInstance() to construct a new Shell.
        Returns:
        a Shell instance
        See Also:
        newInstance()

      • getShell

        public static void getShell(@NonNull
                            Shell.GetShellCallback callback)
        Get Shell via getCachedShell() or create new if required, returns via callback. If getCachedShell() does not return null, the callback will be called immediately, or else it will call newInstance() in a background thread and invoke the callback in the main thread.
        Parameters:
        callback - called when a shell is acquired.

      • getStatus

        public abstract int getStatus()
        Get the status of the shell.
        Returns:
        the status of the shell. Value is either UNKNOWN, NON_ROOT_SHELL, ROOT_SHELL, or ROOT_MOUNT_MASTER

      • isAlive

        public abstract boolean isAlive()
        Return whether the Shell is still alive.
        Returns:
        true if the Shell is still alive.

      • isRoot

        public boolean isRoot()
        Return whether the shell has root access.
        Returns:
        true if the shell has root access.

      • newInstance

        @NonNull
public static Shell newInstance()
        Construct a new Shell instance with the default methods.

        There are 3 methods to construct a Unix shell; if any method fails, it will fallback to the next method:

        1. If FLAG_NON_ROOT_SHELL is not set and FLAG_MOUNT_MASTER is set, construct a Unix shell by calling su --mount-master. It may fail if the root implementation does not support mount master.
        2. If FLAG_NON_ROOT_SHELL is not set, construct a Unix shell by calling su. It may fail if the device is not rooted, or root permission is not granted.
        3. Construct a Unix shell by calling sh. This would never fail in normal conditions, but should it fails, it will throw NoShellException
        The developer should check the status of the returned Shell with getStatus() since it may return the result of any of the 3 possible methods.
        Returns:
        a new Shell instance.
        Throws:
        NoShellException - impossible to construct a Shell instance, or initialization failed when using the configured Shell.Initializer.

      • newInstance

        @NonNull
public static Shell newInstance(String... commands)
        Construct a new Shell instance with provided commands.
        Parameters:
        commands - commands that will be passed to Runtime.exec(String[]) to create a new Process.
        Returns:
        a new Shell instance.
        Throws:
        NoShellException - the provided command cannot create a Shell instance, or initialization failed when using the configured Shell.Initializer.

      • newJob

        @NonNull
public abstract Shell.Job newJob()
        Construct a new Shell.Job that will use the shell for execution.

        Be aware that unlike Shell.su(...)/Shell.sh(...), NO output will be produced if the developer did not set the output destination with Shell.Job.to(List) or Shell.Job.to(List, List).

        Returns:
        a job that the developer can execute or submit later.

      • rootAccess

        public static boolean rootAccess()
        Return whether the global shell has root access.
        Returns:
        true if the global shell has root access.

      • sh

        @NonNull
public static Shell.Job sh(@NonNull
                                    InputStream in)
        Create a Shell.Job with an InputStream. Check sh(String...) for details.
        Parameters:
        in - the data in this InputStream will be served to STDIN.
        Returns:
        a job that the developer can execute or submit later.

      • sh

        @NonNull
public static Shell.Job sh(@NonNull
                                    String... commands)
        Create a Shell.Job with commands.

        By default a new List will be created internally to store the output after executing Shell.Job.exec() or Shell.Job.submit(Shell.ResultCallback). You can get the internally created List via Shell.Result.getOut() after the job is done. Output of STDERR will be stored in the same list along with STDOUT if the flag FLAG_REDIRECT_STDERR is set; Shell.Result.getErr() will always return an empty list.

        Note: the behavior mentioned above DOES NOT apply if the developer manually override output destination with either Shell.Job.to(List) or Shell.Job.to(List, List).

        Shell will not be requested until the developer invokes either Shell.Job.exec(), Shell.Job.submit(), or Shell.Job.submit(Shell.ResultCallback). It is possible to construct complex Shell.Job before the program will request any root access.

        If the developer plan to simply construct a job and add operations with Job.add(InputStream/String...)) afterwards, call this method with no arguments.

        Parameters:
        commands - the commands to run within the Shell.Job.
        Returns:
        a job that the developer can execute or submit later.

      • su

        @NonNull
public static Shell.Job su(@NonNull
                                    InputStream in)
        Equivalent to sh(InputStream) with root access check.

      • su

        @NonNull
public static Shell.Job su(@NonNull
                                    String... commands)
        Equivalent to sh(String...) with root access check.

      • waitAndClose

        public void waitAndClose()
                  throws IOException
        Wait for all tasks to be done indefinitely before closing the shell and releasing any system resources associated with the shell.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • waitAndClose

        public abstract boolean waitAndClose(long timeout,
                                     @NonNull
                                     TimeUnit unit)
                              throws IOException,
                                     InterruptedException
        Wait for all tasks to be done before closing this shell and releasing any system resources associated with the shell.

        Blocks until all tasks have completed execution, or the timeout occurs, or the current thread is interrupted, whichever happens first.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        true if this shell is terminated and false if the timeout elapsed before termination. The shell can still to be used afterwards in this case.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        InterruptedException - if interrupted while waiting.
